title: How Google is supporting the circular economy
summary: Google is committed to a circular economy, aiming to minimize waste and maximize resource reuse.  The company emphasizes design for circularity, extending product lifecycles, and promoting safe materials across its data centers, campuses, and product lines. Google also highlights the role of AI, deconstruction, and e-waste management in achieving a circular economy, acknowledging the need for data availability, scaling innovation, and collective action.
product_or_process: Pixel phone, zero-waste data centers, circularity strategies in campuses and buildings
likely_naics_codes: ['519190 - Data Processing, Hosting, and Related Services', '334413 - Computer and Peripheral Equipment Manufacturing', '541330 - Engineering Services', '561421 - Waste Collection']
greenwashing: The article does not present evidence of greenwashing; it demonstrates genuine efforts towards environmental sustainability and transparency.

title: Design issues concerning circular economy assessment methods at the product level: a comparative analysis through a case study of a mobile tiny house
summary: The article explores the circularity of a tiny house prototype built with sustainable materials like hemp bricks and spruce wood.  Six different circularity assessment tools were used to evaluate the prototype's environmental impact and the results suggest a moderate level of circularity. The researchers highlight the need to integrate circular economy principles throughout the design, manufacturing, and end-of-life stages of buildings to improve sustainability.

greenwashing: There is no indication of greenwashing in the article; the tiny house prototype appears to be genuinely focused on sustainable materials and practices.

title: Contour chair by Pearson Lloyd for Senator
summary: Pearson Lloyd, a British design studio, has created a versatile chair named Contour for office furniture company Senator. The chair emphasizes simplicity and ergonomic comfort, using recycled polypropylene for the backrest and recycled fabric for the covers. Contour prioritizes circularity and longevity, with easily repairable parts and a focus on keeping materials in a closed loop.
